alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 14 at 2:18PM MST until August 14 at 5:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Apache County in northeastern Arizona... * Until 515 PM MST. * At 216 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area, from just north of Ganado, to Nazlini, to just south of Chinle. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Nazlini, Kinlichee Chapter House and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following highways... State Route 264 between mile markers 450 and 455. Highway 191 between mile markers 433 and 440. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Pueblo Colorado Wash, Ruin Wash, Tse Ba Ni Zi Ni Wash, Tse Deeshzhaai Wash, Lone Tule Wash, Bis Ii Ah Wash, Red Clay Wash, Quartzite Canyon, Sage House Wash, Nazlini Wash, Black Soil Wash and Fish Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
